MODULE.name: AUDPROC_MODULE_ID_MCHAN_IIR_TUNING_FILTER
MODULE.description:
ID of the Multiple Channel IIR Tuning#[ #] Filter module.
This module supports the following parameter IDs
- #AUDPROC_PARAM_ID_MCHAN_IIR_TUNING_FILTER_ENABLE
-#[ #] #AUDPROC_PARAM_ID_MCHAN_IIR_TUNING_FILTER_PREGAIN
- #AUDPROC_PARAM_ID_MCHAN_IIR_TUNING_FILTER_CONFIG_PARAMS
- #AUDPROC_PARAM_ID_ENABLE

CONFIG_ELEMENT.name: channel_type
CONFIG_ELEMENT.description:
Channel type for which the IIR enable is to be#[ #] applied.

PCM_CHANNEL_NULL=0
PCM_CHANNEL_L=1
PCM_CHANNEL_R=2
PCM_CHANNEL_C=3
PCM_CHANNEL_LS=4
PCM_CHANNEL_RS=5
PCM_CHANNEL_LFE=6
PCM_CHAN#[ #]NEL_CB=7
PCM_CHANNEL_LB=8
PCM_CHANNEL_RB=9
PCM_CHANNEL_TS=10
PCM_CHANNEL_TFC=11
PCM_CHANNEL_MS=12
PCM_CHANNEL_FLC=13
PCM_CHANNEL_FRC=14
PCM#[ #]_CHANNEL_RLC=15
PCM_CHANNEL_RRC=16
PCM_CHANNEL_LFE2=17
PCM_CHANNEL_SL=18
PCM_CHANNEL_SR=19
PCM_CHANNEL_LVH=20
PCM_CHANNEL_RVH=21
PCM_CHANNEL#[ #]_TC=22
PCM_CHANNEL_TBL=23
PCM_CHANNEL_TBR=24
PCM_CHANNEL_TSL=25
PCM_CHANNEL_TSR=26
PCM_CHANNEL_TBC=27
PCM_CHANNEL_BFC=28
PCM_CHANNEL_BFL=29\#[ #]nPCM_CHANNEL_BFR=30
PCM_CHANNEL_LW=31
PCM_CHANNEL_RW=32
PCM_CHANNEL_LSD=33
PCM_CHANNEL_RSD=34

CONFIG_ELEMENT.name: reserved1
CONFIG_ELEMENT.description: Clients must set this field to 0.

CONFIG_ELEMENT.name: reserved2
CONFIG_ELEMENT.description: Clients must set this field to 0.

CONFIG_ELEMENT.name: reserved3
CONFIG_ELEMENT.description: Clients must set this field to 0.

CONFIG_ELEMENT.name: enable_flag
CONFIG_ELEMENT.description: Specifies whether the channel IIR is enabled.

PARAMETER.name: AUDPROC_PARAM_ID_MCHAN_IIR_TUNING_FILTER_ENABLE
PARAMETER.description:
ID of the Multichannel IIR Tuning Filter#[ #] Enable parameters used by AUDPROC_MODULE_ID_MCHAN_IIR_TUNING_FILTER.
 Payload of the AUDPROC_PARAM_ID_MCHAN_IIR_TUNING_FILTER_ENABLE channel#[ #] type/IIR enable pairs used by the Multiple Channel IIR Tuning Filter module.
This structure immediately follows the audproc_mchan_iir_enable_t#[ #] structure.

CONFIG_ELEMENT.name: num_channels
CONFIG_ELEMENT.description: Number of channels for which enable flags are provided.\n IIR_TUNING_FILTER_MAX_CHANNELS_V2=32

CONFIG_ELEMENT.name: preGain
CONFIG_ELEMENT.description: Pregain of IIR for this channel (in Q27 format).

PARAMETER.name: AUDPROC_PARAM_ID_MCHAN_IIR_TUNING_FILTER_PREGAIN
PARAMETER.description: Payload of the#[ #] AUDPROC_PARAM_ID_MCHAN_IIR_TUNING_FILTER_PREGAIN channel type/IIR pregain pairs used by the Multiple Channel IIR Tuning Filter module.\nThis#[ #] structure immediately follows the audproc_mchan_iir_pregain_t structure.\n

CONFIG_ELEMENT.name: num_channels
CONFIG_ELEMENT.description: Number of channels for which pregains are provided

CONFIG_ELEMENT.name: preGain_settings
CONFIG_ELEMENT.description: Number of channels for which pregains are provided

PARAMETER.name: AUDPROC_PARAM_ID_MCHAN_IIR_TUNING_FILTER_CONFIG_PARAMS
PARAMETER.description:
Payload of the#[ #] #AUDPROC_PARAM_ID_MCHAN_IIR_TUNING_FILTER_CONFIG_PARAMS parameters used by the Multichannel IIR Tuning Filter module.
This structure is followed by#[ #] the multichannel IIR filter coefficients as follows
- Channel type/configuration pairs - See the Payload format table.
- Sequence of int32#[ #] ulFilterCoeffs - Five coefficients for each band, each in int32 format in the order of b0, b1, b2, a1, a2.
- Sequence of int16 sNumShiftFactor -#[ #] One int16 per band. The numerator shift factor is related to the Q factor of the filter coefficients b0, b1, b2.

There must be one data sequence#[ #] per channel.
If the number of bands is odd, there must be an extra 16-bit padding by the end of the numerator shift factors. This extra 16-bit#[ #] padding makes the entire structure 32-bit aligned. The padding bits must be all zeros.

CONFIG_ELEMENT.name: num_channels
CONFIG_ELEMENT.description: Number of channels for which enable flags are provided.
